root_text.an1.1:1.2: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
root_text.an1.1:2.1: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekarūpampi samanupassāmi yaṁ evaṁ purisassa cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, itthirūpaṁ.
root_text.an1.1:2.2: Itthirūpaṁ, bhikkhave, purisassa cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī”ti.
root_text.an1.2:1.1: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekasaddampi samanupassāmi yaṁ evaṁ purisassa cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, itthisaddo.
root_text.an1.2:1.2: Itthisaddo, bhikkhave, purisassa cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī”ti.
root_text.an1.3:1.1: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekagandhampi samanupassāmi yaṁ evaṁ purisassa cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, itthigandho.
root_text.an1.3:1.2: Itthigandho, bhikkhave, purisassa cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī”ti.
root_text.an1.4:1.1: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekarasampi samanupassāmi yaṁ evaṁ purisassa cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, itthiraso.
root_text.an1.4:1.2: Itthiraso, bhikkhave, purisassa cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī”ti.
root_text.an1.5:1.1: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekaphoṭṭhabbampi samanupassāmi yaṁ evaṁ purisassa cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, itthiphoṭṭhabbo.
root_text.an1.5:1.2: Itthiphoṭṭhabbo, bhikkhave, purisassa cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī”ti.
root_text.an1.6:1.1: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekarūpampi samanupassāmi yaṁ evaṁ itthiyā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, purisarūpaṁ.
root_text.an1.6:1.2: Purisarūpaṁ, bhikkhave, itthiyā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī”ti.
root_text.an1.7:1.1: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekasaddampi samanupassāmi yaṁ evaṁ itthiyā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, purisasaddo.
root_text.an1.7:1.2: Purisasaddo, bhikkhave, itthiyā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī”ti.
root_text.an1.8:1.1: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekagandhampi samanupassāmi yaṁ evaṁ itthiyā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, purisagandho.
root_text.an1.8:1.2: Purisagandho, bhikkhave, itthiyā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī”ti.
root_text.an1.9:1.1: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekarasampi samanupassāmi yaṁ evaṁ itthiyā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, purisaraso.
root_text.an1.9:1.2: Purisaraso, bhikkhave, itthiyā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī”ti.
root_text.an1.10:1.1: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekaphoṭṭhabbampi samanupassāmi yaṁ evaṁ itthiyā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, purisaphoṭṭhabbo.
root_text.an1.10:1.2: Purisaphoṭṭhabbo, bhikkhave, itthiyā cittaṁ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī”ti.

translation_text.an1.1:0.2: The Chapter on What Occupies the Mind
translation_text.an1.1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
translation_text.an1.1:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
translation_text.an1.1:2.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sight that occupies a man’s mind like the sight of a woman.
translation_text.an1.1:2.2: The sight of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
translation_text.an1.2:1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sound that occupies a man’s mind like the sound of a woman.
translation_text.an1.2:1.2: The sound of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
translation_text.an1.3:1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single smell that occupies a man’s mind like the smell of a woman.
translation_text.an1.3:1.2: The smell of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
translation_text.an1.4:1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single taste that occupies a man’s mind like the taste of a woman.
translation_text.an1.4:1.2: The taste of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
translation_text.an1.5:1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single touch that occupies a man’s mind like the touch of a woman.
translation_text.an1.5:1.2: The touch of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
translation_text.an1.6:1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sight that occupies a woman’s mind like the sight of a man.
translation_text.an1.6:1.2: The sight of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
translation_text.an1.7:1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sound that occupies a woman’s mind like the sound of a man.
translation_text.an1.7:1.2: The sound of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
translation_text.an1.8:1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single smell that occupies a woman’s mind like the smell of a man.
translation_text.an1.8:1.2: The smell of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
translation_text.an1.9:1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single taste that occupies a woman’s mind like the taste of a man.
translation_text.an1.9:1.2: The taste of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
translation_text.an1.10:1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single touch that occupies a woman’s mind like the touch of a man.
translation_text.an1.10:1.2: The touch of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”

variant_text.an1.1:0.2: Rūpādivagga → cittapariyādānavaggo (bj); ekadhammādipāḷi (cck); ekadhammādipāli (sya1ed, sya2ed); rūpavagga (pts1ed)
